title: Senior Business Analyst
description:
At Pearson, we’re committed to a world that’s always learning and to our talented team who makes it all possible. From bringing lectures vividly to life, to creating interactive and engaging courseware, to creating textbooks, we are always re-examining the way people learn best, whether it’s one child in our own backyard or an education community across the globe. We are bold thinkers and standout innovators who motivate each other to explore new frontiers in an environment that supports and inspires us to always be better. By pushing the boundaries of technology — and each other to surpass these boundaries — we create seeds of learning that become the catalyst for the world’s innovations, personal and global, large and small.

Summary

We are looking for a experienced Business Analyst to support the requirements gathering, development, testing, and implementation of the content authoring, development, and delivery tools and services.

Responsibilities

The analyst will work as part of the project team along with working with business stakeholders (at various levels) to ensure our tools and services meet business requirements and is in alignment with Pearson vision, technology, roadmaps and/or standards. This person is expected to have a proven track record for business analysis with experience in capturing as-is and to-be business processes and implementing technologies to meet business and learner needs. They will understand the industry specifically content management and have an in depth understanding of business processes and workflows, technical standards, specifications and policies that are supported within the environment.

In this role, the person will be required to take a business centric approach and interact with business users--across all levels of the organization to ensure that Business Requirements are documented, managed, prioritized, signed off, tested and that the system is successfully adopted by the Users.


Facilitate requirement gathering meetings via workshops, interviews, case studies and any other effective means
Identify, define, interpret and clarify scope of problems/issues in terms of business and/or system requirements and processes
Document and maintain Operational Processes including capture of As Is Processes and definition and mapping of To Be Processes (in conjunction with technology)
Communicate complex business needs into clear, actionable systems requirements, researches and evaluates alternative solutions.
Evaluate design of existing systems and target core Platform to judge their functionality, effectiveness, reliability, performance, usage, maintainability and cost of ownership.
Create Acceptance Criteria
Create UAT scenarios and oversee the UAT process
Conduct Stakeholder analysis
Work with technology development teams to enable them to define solutions
Work with the test team to ensure requirements are understood and testable
Work to ensure that user training needs are met
Demonstrate understanding of technical details and solutions
Articulate data requirements and data quality standards
Collaborate with other analysts and project contributors to create comprehensive and cohesive solution approaches.
Solve complex problems and support the development of innovative solutions related to the asset management platform for work in progress and archive processes for content and products; while driving for OOTB solutions and articulate pros/cons of customizations
Deliver optimal and scalable solutions with best practice


Key Program Challenges


Working in a matrixed and virtual environment
Working with a number of stakeholders: externally, internally and internationally
Working as part of a global team and thinking globally
Some out of hours working will be required to support the global organization
Building internal confidence in a situation of consistent change
Developing effective solutions that not only satisfy immediate project requirements but also deliver a coherent, reusable, reliable and phased transformation of business processes enable through technology to help the business grow and change while aligning to strategic vision.


Essential Skills And Experience


Bachelor's Degree or has relevant experience
Professional Qualifications / Certified Business Analyst
At least 5 years of proven experience in a Business Analyst role covering the end-to-end project lifecycle and all of the responsibilities above
Educated to degree level or has relevant experience
Worked Agile environments
Experience with content creation, management, and development solutions
Enterprise business solutioning experience for large corporations
Experience with gherkin method for requirements writing


Desired Experience


Experience within Publishing or Media
Specific BA certifications


Skills/knowledge/abilities   


Ability to perform efficiently within a high pressure, fast-paced environment.
Excellent problem-solving skills required
Self starter
Excellent communication, leadership, organization, research, and team-work skills required
Proficient in process mapping applications
Proficient in Microsoft Office suite products
Able to demonstrate a range of techniques to elicit requirements
